resources and of course much more agility as an organization but even in the cloud

Tim so we're here to we're here today to talk about how we use serverless to validate perform a half a trillion data
validations a day it's a big problem we have to solve and this Lambda has helped us a lot
so first just to understand a little bit about who we are so finra is the financial industry regulator Authority
and we monitor 99% of all trading and US listed equities to provide investor protection
and identify fraudulent activity some of you may have heard of things like insider trading and these are the types
of things that we're trying to look out for to try to help you but this requires data and lots and lots of data we receed
the market data from the exchanges and the broker dealers every day sometimes
up to 75 billion records a day the first thing we have to do with that data is we
have to validate it it's critical they're required to provide us data and so we have an obligation to make sure
the data is correct and provide feedback to them so that they can correct it and get it to us it's important it's really

the data and we validate it then we do Market what we call Market reconstruction we take and we stitch the

this is a lot of data and this is on an average day uh we are impacted heavily by the financial by markets things that

rules that the things that we're looking for so when we get the data we have to be able to continue to expand uh what

land on a Nas device we would pull the files in perform the validations generate various error files things of

created a number of challenges not easily scalable this is a big one if you're going to have a static cluster
you're going to have to size it for scale so we would have a cluster that was sitting idle over 50% of the time
well that was very expensive in addition the ongoing server and software
maintenance as Tim just mentioned you know we would have the case where all of a sudden there's a emergency issue with

you're dealing with a system that's running 24 hours a day and it was also originally designed for batch
processing so in thinking about this new architecture we set out with some goals that we thought were very lofty and
number one we want to support any volume Spike on demand we can't predict what's going to happen and when it's going to

that folks can do their analysis so we set out to look at
various Technologies this is kind of a standard process right we Define the criteria we cared about scalability
